statement.tex: Without using a calculator, ascertain which is greater in value -- $\sin 2$ or $\cos 3$? The angles are in radians

options.tex:
%text If $\alpha = 3\text{ radians}$ and $\beta = 2\text{ radians}$ then % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NN}
\hline \text{Angle} & \text{In Quadrant} \\ \hline \alpha & II \\ \hline \beta & III \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %

reason.tex: %text We know that $3 < \pi < 4$. And as $\pi < 4$, therefore $\frac\pi{2} < \frac{4}{2}$ or $2 > \frac\pi{2}$ In other words $\frac\pi{2} < \underbrace{2 < 3}_{\alpha,\beta} < \pi$. Therefore, both $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are in the $II$ quadrant%
%text Both $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are in the second quadrant. Hence, $\sin\alpha > 0$ and $\cos\beta < 0$ And therefore \[\qquad \sin\alpha > \cos\beta\text{ or } \sin 2 > \cos 3\]%
